overview_of_class: In this course we will consider Dickens, "arguably second only to Shakespeare in the pantheon of English writers," as an analyst of the troubled social, psychological, and spiritual patterns of modern life, trying to see how his innovations in novelistic technique arise from, and at the same time give form to, his vividly idiosyncratic vision of modernity.
name: Dickens
title: WCAS ENGLISH 358-0-20 Dickens

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: In this course we will consider Dickens, "arguably second only to Shakespeare in the pantheon of English writers," as an analyst of the troubled social, psychological, and spiritual patterns of modern life, trying to see how his innovations in novelistic technique arise from, and at the same time give form to, his vividly idiosyncratic vision of modernity.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Evaluation based on class presentations and participation, quizzes, and a term paper.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value: David Copperfield (1849-50); Bleak House (1852-53); and Little Dorrit (1855-57).

subject: ENGLISH
